page.title: 05CHANDLER'S FORD LIBRARY (3)
page.content: the book is held. On 31st March 1985 there were 60,044 books in stock but only 27,755 on the shelves. There were 1,461 talking and music cassettes and 610 maps. Probably 10,000 to 15,000 people use the library. There is more non-fiction than fiction on the shelves. You can do these things at the library: work quietly at a desk, borrow books or cassettes, learn a new language by lingua-phone, look at maps and find information from reference books, look at daily and weekly newspapers and magazines, refer to back numbers of these, listen to the half hour storytime for under fives on Monday.W.V.S. workers drop off books for the elderly or housebound.
